slides.title: The Box Model
slides.content:
# The Box Model ðŸ“¦

Every HTML element is a rectangular box. The "Box Model" talks about the layers of this box.

From inside out:
1. **Content** - Text/Image
2. **Padding** - Space around content (inside border)
3. **Border** - Line around padding
4. **Margin** - Space outside border (separates elements)

> ðŸŽ¯ **Analogy:** 
> - Content = Picture
> - Padding = Matting
> - Border = Frame
> - Margin = Space on wall between frames

slides.title: Padding and Margin
slides.content:
# Spacing: Padding vs Margin â†”ï¸

## Padding (Internal)
Transparent space inside the element.
```css
div {
  padding: 20px;       /* All sides */
  padding-top: 10px;   /* Specific side */
  background-color: red; /* Padding shows background */
}
```

## Margin (External)
Space outside. Pushes other elements away.
```css
div {
  margin: 20px;
  margin: 10px 20px; /* Top/Bottom, Left/Right */
  margin: 0 auto;    /* Centers block element horizontally! */
}
```

slides.title: Box Model Quiz
slides.content: Which property adds space INSIDE the border?
slides.quizQuestion: Which property adds space INSIDE the border, around the content?

slides.title: Borders
slides.content:
# Borders ðŸ–¼ï¸

Borders sit between padding and margin.

## Syntax
`border: width style color`

```css
p {
  border: 2px solid black;
  border-radius: 10px; /* Rounded corners! */
}
```

## Styles
- `solid`, `dashed`, `dotted`, `double`, `none`

```css
h1 {
  border-bottom: 5px solid red; /* Underline effect */
}
```
